title.narrative: Yemen - Gateway to Education

description.narrative: (Yemen): USAID's Gateway to Education Program is a flagship activity that supports Yemen's Transition Education Plan (TEP)-a national policy instrument developed as a multi-stakeholder plan to maintain progress towards literacy and longer-term educational goals in Yemen. Through Gateway, USAID aims to increase access to quality education in Yemen where nearly two million children are out of school and most lack basic services such as clean water and nutrition. . .FY 2020 funded activities may include:.- Reviewing, updating, and adapting previously developed grades 1 and 2 teaching and learning materials for literacy and development of grade 3 materials. .- Integrating current efforts to educate out-of-school children (OOSC) through non-formal education with efforts to strengthen the formal school system (i.e. supporting entry and retention in the formal system for OOSC); and .- Working with the Ministry of Education (MOE) to provide teacher development and training to strengthen education service delivery.. .Activities will result in a strengthened, resilient education system that provides a range of services to meet the complex learning needs of the children of Yemen, many of whom have experienced disruptions to their education as Yemen continues to experience a prolonged period of open conflict and an unchecked health crisis due to war and COVID-19. The activities directly contribute to USAID's 2018 Global Education Strategy and the priorities of the MOE as laid out in the Transition Education Plan...... .

title.narrative: Afghanistan Value Chains – Livestock (AVC-L)

description.narrative: (Afghanistan): The Afghanistan Value Chains - Livestock (AVC-Livestock) activity will strengthen the private sector's capacity to effectively connect Afghan producers to domestic and international markets, and to grow the agriculture sector through interventions in the livestock sector. The activity will engage directly with key enterprises to improve their commercial viability through specific, measurable technical support. Examples of such interventions include encouraging private investment in the livestock sector; linking enterprises with international markets; and working within value chains to ensure adherence to sanitation requirements and improve food safety and hygiene. This technical approach will increase livestock productivity, as measured by decreases in animal mortality and increases in secondary product production; increased commercial viability of related agribusinesses; and strengthened networks of agricultural services provided by both the public and private sectors. In addition, AVC-Livestock will work to increase women's equality and empowerment, and improve youth participation in the agribusiness sector. .As peace, security, and relief from COVID-19 improves, communities or rural areas will be more accessible, AVC-Livestock will work to link producers in these areas to new markets while improving productivity and providing employment opportunities to ex-combatants. The project will utilize its GIS tool for data driven decision making to identify underutilized agriculture areas currently contested or under Taliban control. This contributes to the Integrated Country Strategy Mission Goal for economic prosperity based on private sector led exports and job creation. Further, the choice of livestock as the sector of focus for this activity is in line with the Government of Afghanistan's National Comprehensive Agriculture Development Priority Program, which includes livestock among its priorities..

title.narrative: National Health Technical Assistance Program

description.narrative: (Afghanistan): The National Health Technical Assistance Program (NHTAP) will expand access and increase the quality of family planning and reproductive health services (FP/RH). The activity will provide organizational system support at the central and provincial level and deploy support teams to Sehatmandi implementers to deliver FP/RH high impact practices. A key focus area will be increasing access to and availability of quality FP commodities and services at the facility and community levels. This activity contributes to the Objective 2 of the CDCS by improving health services and outcomes. Meanwhile, it contributes to the Development Objective (DO2) and Intermediate Result (IR1) of the Integrated Country Strategy by advancing the social gains through improving the health outcomes. With FY2020 FP/RH funds, NHTAP will continue assisting the GoIRA with FP/RH services that are impacted by COVID-19...Note: This mechanism also supports other areas, including HSS, Infectious Diseases, MNCH, Nutrition, and Tuberculosis. However, the budget for FY 2020 is only requested for FP/RH services. .

sector.narrative: Public sector policy and administrative management

title.narrative: Advancing Higher Education For Afghanistan’s Development (AHEAD)

description.narrative: (Afghanistan): Advancing Higher Education for Afghanistan's Development (AHEAD) is a planned higher education activity to produce a cadre of educated and professionally-qualified Afghan women and men, leading to a more informed and engaged civil society. AHEAD will work with the Ministry of Higher Education, Afghan public and private universities to: 1) Increase access to Higher Education (HE) opportunities, especially for women; 2) Improve the quality and relevance of HE programs aligned with market needs; and 3) Enhance the management capacity of both the Ministry of Higher Education (MoHE) and universities. Achieving these objectives will lead to greater citizen participation in local and national issues of importance to Afghanistan, and will foster appreciation for diversity and promote a culture of tolerance and peaceful co-existence as well as civic pride. USAID assistance will include forging regional and international public-private partnerships between universities, improving the quality of instruction and research, expanding the use of technology and other tools to deliver cutting edge instruction, and developing networks and associations that help solve tasks and promote democratic values in the process. Promotion of technology will enable Afghan Higher Education Institutions to consider varieties of teaching approaches including online learning that will reduce the impact COVID-19 and similar viral infections, which limit physical attendance at the universities. ..Using FY 2020 funds, USAID will provide students with updated curricula and learning experiences aligned with market needs and industry best practice, and will strengthen higher education management systems necessary to sustain education quality for a better educated cadre of professional Afghans. This activity contributes to the Integrated Country Strategy Goal-4 to promote inclusive growth by improving civic education and democratic culture, as well as higher education quality and management

title.narrative: Strengthening Systems for Better Health (Swasthya ko lagi skakchyam Pranali)

description.narrative: (Nepal): .The Strengthening Systems for Better Health (SSBH) activity improves access to sustainable, quality, equitable health services. SSBH supports the GON's new federal structures to promote uninterrupted health service delivery, and will leverage global experience in health systems strengthening to accelerate improvements in health outcomes. USAID provides technical assistance to the MOHP and provincial and municipal governments to improve access to, and use of, quality maternal; newborn and child health; nutrition; water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH); and family planning services in 13 districts. Funding will expand the basic health service package, including nutrition services to underserved areas, either by increasing service delivery points or by improving referral mechanisms, and by supporting municipalities to improve public and private health services. USAID will train and mentor health providers and managers to strengthen the health sector's capacity to generate, analyze, and use real-time data for improved planning and management. Funds will focus on increasing the accountability of local health managers and service providers for quality service delivery (including WASH in health facilities and appropriate WASH and infection prevention and control by health staff) by promoting civil society advocacy; enhancing interactions among municipal governments, facilities, and patient populations; and leveraging the capacity of Health Operation and Management Committees to make health services more responsive to local needs. ..Abt Associates has extensive experience in Nepal and globally on expanding quality health services to vulnerable populations. This activity supports the Embassy Kathmandu's Integrated Country Strategy Mission Goal Two: Increase America's prosperity by developing Nepal as a reliable economic partner and Mission Objective 2.2, Nepal improves health and education outcomes to increase economic productivity..

title.narrative: Sajhedari - Support to Federalism (STF)

description.narrative: (Nepal): Sajhedari: Support to Federalism (STF) is USAID's core activity that supports Nepal's democratic transition to federalism. STF will utilize FY 2020 resources to provide technical assistance to local governments to improve the delivery of essential services, combat the spread of corruption, and build citizen trust in governance systems and processes. STF key interventions will improve the public administration of targeted institutions and support key lawmaking bodies to develop inclusive policies to improve the participation of historically marginalized communities in local government decision-making. STF also supports Nepal's COVID-19 response through its ongoing capacity-strengthening and citizen engagement efforts to improve COVID-19 preparedness, prevention and response to protect vulnerable populations in Provinces 5 and 7, which are among the hardest hit by COVID-19. STF will support women's local-level leadership to strengthen their participation in government and other leadership positions, address emergent women's issues resulting from the COVID-19 crisis, and advance Nepal toward its goals of improved peace, security, and reconciliation. Activities in support of women will be implemented in Provinces 5 and 7, working across 10-15 municipalities. . ..Through its experience implementing USAID/Nepal's health governance activity, Strengthening Systems for Better Health, Abt is able to bring this experience to bear also in STF to strengthen stable local governance by focusing both on building systems and processes. STF is vital to support the Embassy's Integrated Country Strategy Mission Goal One: Promote American security by supporting a stable, secure, democratic, and sovereign Nepal and Mission Objective 1.3: Nepal successfully transitions to a more stable, inclusive, and effective federal democracy based on international norms and free from malign influence. .

title.narrative: Tayar Nepal - Improved Disaster Risk Management Project

description.narrative: (Nepal): .Using FY 2020 resources, USAID's Tayar Nepal - Improved Disaster Risk Management activity will provide technical assistance to improve the government's capacity to implement a multi-hazard approach to disaster mitigation, preparation, response, and recovery at all levels of the federal system. Assistance will build the capacity of a newly formed National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Authority (NDRRMA) and support newly elected local governments to mitigate Nepal's vulnerability to disasters. Tayar Nepal will implement a framework for COVID-19 recovery that will be applicable to future calamities. FY 2020 funding will support the GON to implement best practices in disaster risk financing, enabling the GON to autonomously finance interventions that will improve disaster risk management (DRM), response, recovery, and preparedness. This activity plans to help the GON use empirical approaches to analyze the cost of delivering high quality DRM services in Nepal and efficiently allocate resources towards this purpose. This activity will also work with the GON to identify and assist with implementation of strategies to increase private sector engagement in ways that leverage the government's scarce resources...Tayar Nepal will also leverage the centrally-managed SERVIR activity to improve the management and use of research to inform decision makers and increase the resilience of targeted human and ecological communities to extreme weather and natural disasters...Strengthening Nepal's DRM systems enhances stability and reduces its need for humanitarian assistance. Tayar Nepal is aligned with the Joint Regional Strategy for South and Central Asia Goal 1, Increase countries' stability, security, sovereignty, and the integrity of national borders. .

sector.narrative: Public sector policy and administrative management

title.narrative: Feed the Future Nepal Integrated Pest Management (FTFNIPM)

description.narrative: (Nepal): .The prevalence of crop diseases and pests constrain productivity and progress toward inclusive agriculture-led economic growth. Integrated pest management (IPM) is an approach which minimizes the use of chemical pesticides while effectively controlling pests and diseases. IPM is endorsed by the GON and has multiple benefits for farmers, consumers, the general population, and the environment. USAID selected Virginia Tech University to implement this award based on its technical capacity to partner with Nepal-based sub-awardees and with public and private sector stakeholders to achieve notable IPM results. ..The IPM partnership will invest FY 2020 resources to increase farmers' adoption of IPM for vegetables, maize, rice, and lentils and will enhance the enabling environment for safe and effective plant protection. The activity will address major plant pests and diseases, including the devastating Fall Armyworm and the more recently arrived desert locust. It will build the capacity of public and private sector stakeholders for science-based pest management and pesticide selection processes to reduce pest and pesticide risks and will conduct pesticide safety training of trainers. IPM will conduct as many of its activities virtually as possible to ensure that information reaches technicians and farmers in a safe and timely fashion during the COVID-19 pandemic. IPM will implement its GESI Action Plan, which will ensure that IPM will reach women and marginalized groups with improved technologies and best practices. ..This activity contributes to Embassy Kathmandu's Integrated Country Strategy Goal Two: Increase America's prosperity by developing Nepal as a reliable economic partner and Mission Objective 2.1, Nepal advances inclusive and sustainable economic growth to reduce extreme poverty and increase rules-based trade, competitiveness and cross-border cooperation, and becomes a reliable economic partner for increased American prosperity..

participating-org.narrative: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

title.narrative: Social Cohesion and Reconciliation Program (SCORE)

description.narrative: (Sri Lanka): USAID's Social Cohesion and Reconciliation (SCORE) activity will strengthen Sri Lankan efforts to promote reconciliation and social cohesion among diverse ethnic and religious groups towards an inclusive national identity. Assistance will address underlying grievances that led to Sri Lanka's civil war, long-standing mistrust between ethnic groups, and segregation in the political, economic, and cultural arenas. SCORE supports inclusion of religious and ethnic minorities..SCORE will use FY 2020 funding for activities that counter Buddhist and Muslim violent extremism by addressing the structural drivers which create an enabling environment for violent extremism. Using FY 2020 funding, SCORE will expand activities to work with moderate and influential Muslim clergy, Buddhist monks, and civil society leaders to act as change agents to expand SCORE's work into Buddhist and Muslim hardline communities in the Southern, Central, and Eastern Provinces. In addition, SCORE will promote open dialogue and inter-religious forums, and extend support to district inter-religious committees, to strengthen their work to promote social harmony and religious tolerance. At the national level, SCORE will continue to advocate with national leaders in the parliament and the executive branch to take concrete actions to address issues of communal and religious harmony, and national unity. SCORE will support targeted social media campaigns to counter fake news, social engineering, and radicalization of youth along religious lines, and provide sub-grants to religious networks to carry out social cohesion and reconciliation activities. SCORE will also promote youth networks to strengthen the moderate youth voices in society through non-violent communication and inter-communal youth activities..The activity supports Integrated Country Strategy Mission Objective 3 by supporting key civil society and government institutions to advance the principles of human rights..

title.narrative: NISHTHA: Transforming Comprehensive Healthcare in India

description.narrative: (India): The Government of India's (GOI) Ayushman Bharat initiative aims to ensure Universal Health coverage for every citizen of the country. This is a bold paradigm shift for the GOI, moving from a selective and vertical primary care approach to integrated service delivery at the primary care level. The initiative is expected to yield considerable dividends. With FY 2020 funds, the NISHTHA project will support the implementation of the Ayushman Bharat initiative through integrated Tuberculosis (TB), maternal and child health (MCH) and family planning (FP) activities. NISHTA will provide technical assistance (TA) to strengthen the GOI's capacity to deliver comprehensive primary health care services to vulnerable populations. Interventions will ensure referrals to secondary and tertiary care including linkages to GOI insurance and social support schemes, and strengthen the quality of services delivered through wellness centers. This activity will also support school health under Ayushman Bharat to strengthen linkages to wellness and disease prevention for young people. USAID/India will leverage partnerships to utilize appropriate technology to support the GOI's ambitious target of reaching 500 million Indians. USAID/India will provide service delivery gap filling support for RMNCH+A and TB to proportionally reduce out of pocket expenditure and improve access to services for the most vulnerable populations in urban and rural India. This activity will improve care for expectant mothers before, during and after delivery of newborn and improve care for newborns and children under 5 years of age. Support will strengthen timely detection and treatment of TB patients much closer to their places of residence, thus decreasing loss to follow up and improving treatment completion. The activity will promote well-being across communities to decrease morbidity, and ultimately reduce disease burden, while also factoring in the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic..

title.narrative: Urban Health Platform

description.narrative: (India): This activity takes a total market approach to build a comprehensive, consumer empowered, primary healthcare ecosystem in urban areas..With FY 2020 funds, USAID will improve family planning (FP), maternal and child health (MCH) services, and tuberculosis (TB) care for the urban poor, with a special focus on women, girls, and other vulnerable populations. The activity will work with the government and the private sector to build a responsive and robust urban health ecosystem using following strategic approach, which will: .Provide technical assistance at the national, state, and city levels to strengthen urban health systems to ensure reproductive, maternal, newborn, child, and adolescent health (RMNCH+A), and tuberculosis service delivery to vulnerable populations..Manage sub-grants under an accelerator hub to rapidly scale up proven urban health models; and.Manage a grand challenge fund under an incubator hub to test new concepts and models that deliver quality and affordable FP, MCH, and TB services to the urban poor and vulnerable populations..Given the COVID-19 pandemic, and the challenge that urban slums are differentially impacted, this activity will integrate the COVID-19 context into planned activities, maintaining social distancing, strengthening infection prevention and control, improving sanitization of service delivery points, and protecting personal hygiene. Health authorities will be assisted in case detection and contact tracing to prevent further transmission, while also maintaining critical FP, MCH, and TB services during an ongoing pandemic..To reinforce sustainability and adaptive learning, activities will employ private sector and enterprise driven solutions and use technology to guide programming for urban poor and vulnerable communities. A collaborative learning and adaptive (CLA) model will guide all activity streams. .. .

description.narrative: Improve the capacity of businesses to integrate into domestic and international markets through increases in productivity and improvements in corporate governance and the development and application of modern technology and marketing practices. Enhance the capacity of businesses and business associations in terms of their corporate governance capabilities and their application of best practices and technologies to achieve increased production and marketing of products and services. It includes adoption of efficient production processes, improved labor productivity, environmentally-sound management of natural resources and the development of accounting and management systems that can help the company and industry group implement business, labor, product and process standards that enhance business competitiveness. Business capacity development programs may include activities that help men- and women-owned firms and associations respond to these international markets and create regional alliances.

title.narrative: TB Digital Technologies and Artificial Intelligence

description.narrative: (India): This mechanism aims to introduce artificial intelligence (AI) solutions for TB and other Infectious Diseases such as COVID-19, thereby contributing to strengthening the delivery of health care services and helping to accelerate elimination of TB and respond to infectious diseases outbreaks in India. The project through a technical support unit at national level would help in enabling GoI's TB database systembecome compliant to standardized Electronic Health Records and also support establishing various Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) for health data sharing needed for developing AI based solutions. FY 2020 funds will contribute to develop and scale-up three innovative digital and AI solutions across the TB cascade of care (i.e. AI based solutions to diagnose latent TB, AI enabled reading and transmission of TB Laboratory results, AI based risk stratification for death among TB patients). All of these activities contribute to India's journey to self reliance..

title.narrative: Closing the Gaps in TB Care Cascade

description.narrative: (India): For a person to move across the TB continuum of care, TB and MDR/RR-TB services must be tailored to the needs of the individual, their families and communities. If India, has to achieve the ambitious goal of eliminating TB by 2025, it needs to enable universal access to TB and MDR/RR-TB services to ensure that all persons with signs and symptoms of TB, MDR/RR-TB or at-risk for latent TB infection, including the most vulnerable populations, have access to quality and affordable TB services across the care cascade. Social services, such as psychological and mental health interventions and social protection can contribute to improving TB and MDR/RR-TB outcomes. Investing in continued strategic advocacy, policy analysis and capacity building is critical to reach, treat and cure people with TB and to prevent new infections..This new mechanism will provide TA to demonstrate solutions that will address the barriers and bottlenecks that prevent TB-patients from being correctly diagnosed, initiated on treatment at the earliest and from successfully completing treatment. This is especially important for MDR/RR-TB patients. USAID TA will also be provisioned to create awareness and spur action by engaging non-traditional partners and strengthening the role of the TB civil society. This new mechanism will collaborate closely with the Central TB Department to create an enabling environment for ensuring a holistic cascade of interventions for TB patient care in India. This new mechanism will also provide TA for improving the attitudes and behaviors of providers, patients, communities and politicians and strengthening the existing social protection schemes for TB patients to facilitate appropriate TB care and treatment and reduce stigma and discrimination in all settings. ..

title.narrative: Mamoni Maternal and Newborn Care Strengthening Project (MNCSP) activity

description.narrative: (Bangladesh): The MaMoni Maternal and Newborn Care Strengthening Project (MNCSP) activity will contribute to reduce maternal and neonatal mortality and increase contraceptive prevalence by strengthening the capacity of health systems and facilities through the provision of quality maternal and newborn health care, postpartum family planning, and nutrition services. With FY 2020 funds, MaMoni MNCSP will focus on areas with poor maternal and newborn care indicators reaching vulnerable population groups that are hard to reach. This activity will continue its interventions on improving health system responsiveness, quality of healthcare services, system governance, access to and demand for services, healthy household practices, and the national capacity to scale-up and deliver quality services. The activity will support the institutionalization of comprehensive emergency obstetric and newborn care, as well as midwifery care, in select district hospitals, and build the capacity of service providers to screen for obstetric fistula. MaMoni MNCSP will further strengthen newborn care at all levels, including essential newborn care through special care newborn units (SCANU), helping babies breathe, chlorhexidine use for cord care, and Kangaroo Mother Care. The activity will also increase family planning services through its facility-level interventions, focusing notably postpartum family planning. With FY 2020 funds, MaMoni will also integrate quality nutrition counselling during pregnancy, lactation and demonstrate early initiation of breastfeeding after birth, correct position and attachment etc. Service providers will be capacitated on these nutrition issues and key family members will be counselled to support the mother.This activity will support the U.S. National Security Strategy Pillar IV, the State-USAID Joint Strategic Plan Goal Two, and the U.S. government's mission objective of improved health status in Bangladesh.

title.narrative: Promoting Advocacy and Rights Activity (PAR)

description.narrative: (Bangladesh): .Dwindling freedom of expression and growing restrictions on civil society have made it more difficult for the press and civil society to advocate for policy changes, better services and improved governance. The implementing partner, Counterpart International (CI), works to strengthen civil-society capacity to advocate for improved democratic governance and establish cross-sectoral partnerships to improve government responsiveness to citizens' needs. Through this activity, USAID enables civil-society organizations, policy makers, and government partners to improve civic participation and create a better enabling environment. CI supports advocacy work of CSO and local government coalitions in two priority areas: gender-based violence and drug addiction. The coalitions identify policy gaps and create a charter of actions for local administrations to address such priority areas. CI employs an on-line advocacy toolbox, providing CSOs online guidance for collecting, analyzing and using evidence in advocacy. This toolbox will help CSOs conduct constructive dialogue with the government, legal experts, and other stakeholders. The PAR activity also works to strengthen the digital space and legal environment for CSOs and human-rights activists who increasingly face legal restrictions as a result of laws such as the Digital Security Act. Counterpart provides CSOs with digital security tools and skills and teaches civil-society organizations about their legal rights and compliance responsibilities. To respond to COVID-19 pandemic and its impact CI utilizes social media platforms, print, and electronic media to disseminate awareness raising messages; and works with communities to provide social protection to the victims of GBV and drug users. This activity will be in line with the U.S. National Security Strategy, the State-USAID Joint Strategic Plan Goal One, and the U.S. government objective of increased citizen confidence in Bangladesh governance insti

title.narrative: FTF Bangladesh Aquaculture and Nutrition Activity

description.narrative: (Bangladesh): The Bangladesh Aquaculture and Nutrition activity strengthens the aquaculture market system by connecting key market actors along the fish value chain to increase the availability of quality fish feed and fish fingerling (baby fish), fish production and productivity, processing, transportation, and consumption. Increased adoption of best aquaculture management practices and technologies will enhance the production of quality fish products for domestic, regional and global markets, which will result in increased rural household income and improved nutrition. The activity increases awareness and adoption of nutrition-enhancing behaviors by smallholder aquaculture households through targeted messaging and technical assistance on diversification of household production. It also trains value chain actors on improved production practices and technologies and provides sub-grants for piloting of new innovations and the scale up of successful ones. Value chain actors include hatchery and nursery owners, feed companies, fingerling traders, smallholder farmers, processors, marketers and service providers. To contribute to reducing the impact of COVID-19, the activity will expand support for local vegetable and aquaculture production to maintain diversified diets and improve nutrition; strengthen or re-establish local markets by investing in key value chains; support mechanization and labor saving methods, due to potential labor shortages; identify other opportunities to increase the financial resilience of small and medium enterprises to improve their ability to weather this shock; and leverage existing information dissemination programs (e.g., extension and digital tools) to share critical COVID-19 messages. This activity will support the Global Food Security Strategy and significantly contribute to achieving the State-USAID Joint Strategic Plan Goal Two, and the U.S. government's mission objective of improved food security in Bangladesh.. .

title.narrative: Community Partnerships to Strengthen Sustainable Development (COMPASS)

description.narrative: (Bangladesh): The purpose of this Participating Agency Program Agreement (PAPA) is to establish a partnership between USAID and the U.S. Forest Service (USFS). The activity has several components: promote sustainable land use practices through the development of low emissions development plans and Reducing Emissions from Deforestation and forest Degradation (REDD+) strategies; improve youth employment through a Youth Conservation Corps of Bangladesh; strengthen community capacity and promote public participation and ownership in forestry and Natural Resources Management (NRM) in Bangladesh; increase technical cooperation on forest and ecosystem management; strengthen the capacity of academic and research institutions in NRM and resilience; promote global exchange of natural resource knowledge and skills; and close gender gaps while empowering women and youth in NRM. As a flagship component of this interagency agreement, USFS will establish a Youth Conservation Corps that engages Bangladeshi youth in natural resource management in order to build technical and soft skills while instilling environmental stewardship and creating employment opportunities. The goal of the Youth Conservation Corps is to measurably improve youth employment. Considering the COVID-19 challenge, and nature of the proposed interventions above, knowledge exchange, training, and technical assistance will be provided through online platforms. COMPASS will support Bangladesh to be self-reliant by increasing the capacity of the government, civil society organizations, and universities to develop, finance, and implement effective natural resource management programs. The USFS has a comparative advantage to provide a broad array of technical assistance and a long history of forestry and ecosystem services research and management. This activity supports the U.S. government's objective of strengthening resilience to natural hazards and aligns with Goal Three of the State-USAID Joint Strategic Pl

title.narrative: FTF Bangladesh Horticulture, Fruits and Non-food Crops Activity

description.narrative: (Bangladesh): The Horticulture, Fruits and Non-food Crops activity will support the Government of Bangladesh's food security objective by increasing the private sector's capacity to increase productivity and production of quality horticulture, fruits, and non-food crops that meet international standards. The activity will also strengthen the value chain, linking Bangladeshi smallholder commercial farmers and other value chain actors, thereby increasing the efficiency of the market system to meet domestic and international market demands. This will result in a more competitive private sector and efficient market systems that will increase farmers' income and improve food security of Bangladesh. It will also increase the export potential of fruits, vegetables, and non-food-crops to regional and domestic markets, thereby increasing the ability of Bangladesh to earn foreign exchange for its development purposes.The activity will contribute to achieving the three objectives of the Global Food Security Strategy and the Indo-Pacific Strategy through trade and competitiveness by increasing private sector engagement to bring additional financial and technical tools and expertise to the FTF development portfolio. The activity will further contribute to actualizing the Agency's Journey to Self-Reliance. In response to COVID-19, the activity will strengthen or re-establish local markets by investing in key value chains; support mechanization and labor saving methods, due to potential labor shortages; identify other opportunities to increase the financial resilience of small and medium enterprises in the agri-food system to improve their ability to weather this shock; and leverage existing information dissemination programs to share critical COVID-19 messages. This activity supports the U.S. government's mission objectives of improved food security, and increased fair and reciprocal trade and investment..

title.narrative: TB LON APS: Alliance for Combating Tuberculosis In Bangladesh (ACTB)

description.narrative: (Bangladesh): The Alliance for Combating Tuberculosis in Bangladesh (ACTB) activity will contribute to the reduction of the burden of tuberculosis (TB) by supporting all forms of TB diagnosis, treatment, and prevention needs, and battling stigma and discrimination, by applying locally-derived solutions that tailor USAID's TB response to patients and communities. This Activity will improve identification of TB cases, ensure access to quality patient-centered care for TB and drug-resistant TB, prevent transmission and disease progression, and strengthen TB information platforms through public and private sector channels.With FY 2020 funds, the Activity will increase case notification and improve treatment outcomes for all forms of tuberculosis by providing technical assistance to the Bangladesh National Tuberculosis Program (NTP) at the national and subnational levels. The activity will support service delivery interventions to actively detect TB at an early stage; scale-up the provision of shorter treatment regimens and new drugs for drug-resistant TB; and, increase TB preventive therapy for people closely exposed to the disease. The activity will work closely with the NTP, different divisions of the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, and local government and municipalities to improve case detection, notification, diagnosis, and treatment in selected areas of Bangladesh. Strengthening existing health systems, including private sector stakeholders, to combat TB among at-risk population will support Bangladesh's journey to self-reliance.The activity will support the U.S. National Security Strategy Pillar IV, the State-USAID Joint Strategic Plan Goal Two, and the U.S. government's mission objective of improved health status in Bangladesh.. .

title.narrative: USAID Linkages for Small and Medium Enterprises (LinkSME)

description.narrative: USAID Linkages for Small and Medium Enterprises (LinkSME) aims to strengthen the supplier-buyer relationships between Vietnamese small and medium enterprises (SMEs) and multinationals located in Vietnam to help local firms participate in global value chains. USAID LinkSME will improve the business environment by lowering costs for multinationals located in Vietnam to source locally while representing a huge opportunity to grow Vietnams SME sector and build its middle class, major consumers of American products. The project is also helping to improve Vietnams regional competitiveness, by making it a more attractive and predictable investment climate and supporting the Indo Pacific Strategys competitiveness pillar.

title.narrative: Cambodia Social and Behavior Change (Promoting Healthy Behaviors)

description.narrative: (Cambodia): PHB aims to improve health behaviors among Cambodians through two objectives: 1) strengthening health systems for oversight and coordination of social behavior change (SBC); and 2) improving the ability of individuals to adopt healthy behaviors. Interventions will address barriers to health behavior change, both cross-cutting and specific to family planning; tuberculosis; malaria; maternal and child health; nutrition; and, water, sanitation, and hygiene..With FY 2020 funds, PHB will provide technical assistance to develop and implement targeted SBC activities. The activity will conduct demonstration interventions that use a human-centered design approach to change individual behaviors through innovative, effective SBC strategies. PHB will target six provinces with specific key health activities determined through a co-assessment and co-design process with key stakeholders. At national and sub-national levels, funds will support a mass media campaign targeting adolescents and women of reproductive age on family planning myths and misconceptions, and switching traditional users to modern contraceptive users. The campaign will also improve individual knowledge on TB treatment adherence and other antenatal and postnatal care with nutrition and WASH health education. PHB will also strengthen the risk communication for COVID-19 through social media and community work to improve knowledge on COVID-19 information and prevention measures..The activity falls under the Administration priority to assert U.S. leadership and influence by improving global public health through improving the health behaviors of Cambodians. In addition, the activity contributes to Mission Objective 4.1 (CDCS DO2) to improve health and education with a focus on vulnerable populations. The activity was awarded through a competitive process in which the offeror with the best value to the U.S. government was selected, in accordance with federal procurement regulations....

sector.narrative: Pandemic Influenza and Other Emerging Threats (PIOET)

title.narrative: Enhancing Quality of Healthcare Activity (EQHA)

description.narrative: (Cambodia): EQHA will improve the quality of health services in both public and private facilities by providing technical assistance to health facility teams to develop and implement patient-centered quality improvement (QI) plans in six target provinces. EQHA will improve the integrating disease-specific QI needs into the routine public health assessment system, which will motivate health facilities--through a national performance-based incentive program--to prioritize key disease specific services as part of routine service delivery. With FY 2020 funds, EQHA will continue to work with the public and private sectors to increase demand for, access to, and quality of priority health services such as modern contraceptive methods for family planning, tuberculosis and HIV/AIDS. Partnering with health professional associations, EQHA will promote a continuing professional development system as well as strengthen the implementation and enforcement of regulation, licensing, and accreditation requirements. EQHA will work with health training institutions to reform training methodologies to produce better-trained healthcare providers. EQHA will also work to improve access to health and social services for survivors of the Khmer Rouge. EQHA will continue to build on its quality improvement platform to improve Cambodia to prepare, detect, and respond to COVID-19 in Cambodia. .EQHA supports the Administration's priorities to assert U.S. influence by leveraging partnerships with the private sector, improving global public health, and preventing the spread of disease and pandemics. EQHA contributes to Mission Objective 4.1 (CDCS DO2) "Improving health and education with a focus on vulnerable populations" and supports Cambodia's self-reliance by strengthening the health system for Cambodians. EQHA was awarded through a competitive process in which the offeror with the best value to the U.S. government was selected, in accordance with federal procurement regulations. ...

title.narrative: Women Entrepreneurs Act (WE Act)

description.narrative: (Cambodia): With FY 2020 funds, the 'Women Entrepreneurs Act' (WE Act) activity, in its third year of operation, will continue to help women-owned micro-, small and medium-sized businesses to formalize and expand. It will also help young women and organizations led by women access knowledge, tools and resources they need to succeed in the market. Interventions will focus on improving business skills and providing sub-grants to local organizations and business associations to promote women's entrepreneurship. FY 2020 funds will build on the 2019 partnership with Facebook to expand the pilot e-commerce training partnership with WE Act, which will train several thousand young women entrepreneurs in digital marketing. FY 2020 funds will also build youth networks and support civic initiatives, via grants to local organizations, designed to influence decision-making about policies affecting women. FY 2020 funds will also help women-owned micro-enterprises in the informal sector (e.g., street vendors) to overcome the adverse economic effects of COVID-19..This activity falls under the Administration priority of "fostering economic opportunities for the American people" by promoting private sector productivity and leveraging private sector partnerships. In addition, the activity contributes to Mission Objective 1.2 (CDCS DO1) to "strengthen credible voices to promote fundamental democratic principles and human rights." This activity supports the Indo-Pacific Strategy under the Indo Pacific Transparency Initiative's Social domain. The activity was awarded through a competitive process in which the offeror with the best value to the U.S. government was selected, in accordance with federal procurement regulations..

title.narrative: Labor Rights in Cambodia (LRIC)

description.narrative: (Cambodia): .FY 2020 funds will be used to strengthen labor rights as a means of advancing the fundamental rights by improving representation of worker interests in targeted sectors, strengthening links between workers and the larger civil society, and increasing the effectiveness of labor relations systems. This activity will advance traditional labor rights - collective bargaining, unionization, rights of assembly and information - and encourage effective approaches to restore space for union and civic organizations lost to government suppression. The activity will also train independent journalists to cover labor issues in Cambodia, make key labor data more accessible to journalists, unions, CSOs, and the public. This activity will support workers negatively affected by COVID-19, with an emphasis on bargaining with employers and government to maintain salaries, benefits and protections compromised due to the pandemic...By promoting fair labor practices and strengthening protection of workers' rights, this activity contributes to Mission Objective 1.2 (CDCS DO 1) "Strengthening credible voices to promote fundamental democratic principles and human rights." It also supports the Indo-Pacific Transparency Initiative's human rights domain. In accordance with federal procurement regulations, this activity was awarded to Solidarity Center based on the best value to the U.S. government..

title.narrative: Tourism For All Project
Turismo para todo o projeto

description.narrative: (Timor Leste): Os investimentos de USAID promovem a concorrência do TL como um destino internacional do turismo ao preservar sua herança ambiental e cultural original. Este setor foi escolhido para a ajuda ao desenvolvimento baseada no raciocínio sadio. As revisões setoriais detalhadas múltiplas por peritos globais indicam que o setor do turismo está posicionado para criar muitos trabalhos para trabalhadores pouco qualificado ao expandir e ao diversificar a economia. Com herança cultural e paisagens naturais como os ativos subdesenvolvidos chaves, desenvolver o setor do turismo é um essencial destravar a capacidade plena destes ativos. Finalmente, T4A é alinhado proximamente com as prioridades nacionais da política do turismo do GoTL de contratar o governo, o setor privado, a sociedade civil e as comunidades incentivar o investimento e a colaboração público-privado com as práticas de gestão ambientais responsáveis. Chemonics foi escolhido executar atividades neste setor baseado em um modelo aberto da obtenção com a melhores proposta e valor. As atividades piloto do ano um serão escaladas durante o ano dois nas zonas do projeto da influência que abrange as montanhas do noroeste do litoral e da próximo-costa. As intervenções centrar-se-ão sobre a política eficaz do turismo, parcerias privadas, estratégias de marketing, e desenvolvimento do conselho da supervisão do destino. As concessões sob o contrato construirão a capacidade de negócios e promoverão a concorrência de Timor-Leste's como um destino internacional do turismo. T4A alinha com a coluna IV da estratégia da segurança nacional incentivando um sócio alinhado com os valores americanos que incluem economias setor-conduzidas privadas. T4A alinha com o objetivo 2 do plano estratégico comum e da estratégia Indo-pacífica promovendo populações produtivas para conduzir princípios do mercado livre e o desenvolvimento sustentável. Promover o progresso do país em sua viagem à confiança T4A ajudará em construir a capacidade do GoTL financiar e executar soluções a seus próprios desafios do desenvolvimento...

(Timor-Leste): .USAID promotes Timor-Leste's competitiveness as an international tourism destination while preserving the country's unique environmental assets and cultural heritage. Global experts indicate that the tourism sector is well-positioned to create many jobs for low-skilled workers while expanding and diversifying the economy. With cultural heritage and natural landscapes as key underdeveloped assets, developing tourism is essential to unlock their economic potential. With FY2020 funds, this activity will support implementation of the existing tourism policy, establishing a tourism association, and developing public-private partnerships for the management of public assets. It will also support marketing and promotion activities and preservation of cultural and natural assets. Currently, the main tourism attractions in TL are nature-based areas that are vulnerable to climate-related shocks. Poorly planned and managed tourism activities could have significant adverse impacts on the environment as well as on these resources. Ecosystem-based adaptation activities will include the establishment of sustainable management plans in vulnerable areas, such as terrestrial and marine protected sites, to ensure that adequate conservation measures are in place to protect high value sites for tourism and terrestrial environments or historic and cultural locations. All activity and subgrant awards will consider climate risks in ensuring that USAID investments are protected against long term climate variability.Due to the COVID-19 pandemic and reduced international travel, the project will pivot to promote domestic tourism for Timorese through the My Timor-Leste campaign. Tourism For All supports Pillar IV of the NSS by encouraging a partner to align with American values, including developing a business-enabling environment and a private sector-driven economy. This activity also aligns JSP and the IPS by promoting free market principles and sustainable development...

title.narrative: USAID Microenterprise

description.narrative: (Laos): Laos Microenterprise strengthens the competitiveness of agricultural microenterprises in Laos, which remain uncompetitive and poorly integrated into domestic and regional markets. With two-thirds of the labor force working in the agriculture sector, strengthening agricultural microenterprises and improving market access will contribute to Laos' Journey to Self-Reliance as private sector investment and trade bolster this agrarian country's capacity to manage and fund its own development solutions. At the same time, agribusiness and agricultural value chain investments create opportunities for U.S. businesses seeking to diversify their overseas production base -- creating a potentially cost-effective entry point into the rapidly growing ASEAN economic community.The activity works with public and private sector partners to equip agricultural microenterprises and farmers with the skills needed to respond to market needs and access technology and facilities, while also assisting them to reduce operations costs by enhancing their negotiating power and establishing reliable linkages between microenterprise groups and markets. Laos Microenterprise also helps microenterprises gain access to finance by increasing the ability of financial institutions, such as savings banks and credit unions, to manage and assess loans as well as develop new financial products tailored to the needs of microenterprises. This is combined with support for expanding markets and establishing linkages with larger buyers both domestically and abroad.

Objectives for Laos: The project aims to: At least 8,000 supported microenterprises improve their business performance; 25 percent increase in income for beneficiary firms; 2,000 microenterprises linked to other businesses through partnerships; 180 market linkages created between farmers’ groups and buyers.

participating-org.narrative: Agriculture Cooperative Development International/Volunteers in Overseas Cooperative Assistance

title.narrative: USAID Local Solutions Support in Lao PDR

description.narrative: (Laos): The USAID Local Solutions Support Task Order aims to promote Laos' Journey to Self-Reliance by working with the private sector, civil society organizations (CSOs), local institutions and other groups to build the capacity of local organizations to take greater ownership in shaping and addressing the development agenda for Lao People's Democratic Republic. USAID believes locally identified solutions will better address the country context and issues. Therefore, by supporting capacity development of local organizations, the program also seeks to increase the impact of U.S. foreign assistance by developing a greater understanding of capacity gaps and strengthening the ability of local organizations to effectively operationalize and manage their organizations and eventually be able to contribute to their national development, including the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).

Objectives for Laos: The USAID Local Solutions Support activity aims to: 1) Improves human resources, systems and the sustainability of local institutions; 2) Enhances the ability of local institutions to generate and diversify revenue streams; 3) Increases collaboration and connectivity among civil society institutions in Laos, within and across sectors; 4) Increases pool of local service providers capable of supporting their peers in the long term

title.narrative: TB Innovations and Health Systems Strengthening (TB Innovations)

description.narrative: (Philippines): The Tuberculosis (TB) Innovations activity strengthens national and regional level implementation of the Philippine Strategic TB Elimination Plan (PhilSTEP) by supporting the Department of Health (DOH) to develop and scale up high impact interventions to prevent, detect and treat TB. These interventions strengthen the capacity of local partners, thereby advancing the country's journey to self-reliance. By helping to eliminate TB in the Philippines, the project contributes to the U.S. foreign policy priority to defend the U.S. from the spread of deadly infectious diseases. This activity is aligned with USAID's Global Accelerator to End TB.FY 2020 funds will assist the DOH to adjust and recover from reductions in TB service delivery due to COVID-19 by ensuring services are restored and strategies and approaches under the National TB Control Program's Adaptive Plan are carried out. TB Innovations will support the implementation of a "screen all" approach, ensuring that all patients visiting a health facility will be screened for TB. The activity will support the expansion of a network of public and private laboratories and diagnostic facilities that will provide comprehensive and high quality TB diagnostic services, including the use of chest X-ray as a screening tool and scaling up the use of Xpert as the primary diagnostic tool. FY 2020 funds will also support the modelling of Universal Health Care approaches, including the provision of primary care package, organizing a health care provider network, and developing financing and local governance mechanisms with the support of other implementing mechanisms. The activity will strengthen the high level body (National Coordinating Committee) to oversee progress and ensure achievement of national targets; engage the private sector to improve its capacity to manage the disease; and institutionalize policies to reduce TB transmission.

title.narrative: TB Platforms for Sustainable Detection, Care and Treatment (TB Platforms)

description.narrative: (Philippines): The Tuberculosis (TB) Platforms activity will bolster TB services at the regional, provincial, and community levels. By strengthening and sustaining essential supportive and cross-cutting TB interventions, the activity will increase case detection of TB and drug-resistant TB (DR-TB) and improve treatment success rates. This activity is designed to meet the priorities and objectives in the U.S. government's Global TB Strategy and USAID's Global Accelerator to End TB. By helping cure people with TB, the activity contributes to defending the U.S. from the spread of deadly infectious diseases, a U.S. foreign policy priority. TB elimination also supports the U.S. government Mission Objective to accelerate and sustain broad-based and inclusive growth. FY 2020 funds will support local government units (LGUs) to adjust and recover from reductions in TB and DR-TB service delivery due to COVID-19 by working with LGUs and other implementing mechanisms to implement the National TB Control Program's Adaptive Plan to COVID-19 and universal health care. TB Platforms will support local healthcare providers to adopt high impact case-finding approaches, including contact investigation and the FAST (Finding cases actively, separating safely, treating effectively) Plus strategy. The activity will work with affected communities to increase demand for TB services by providing social and behavior change activities that include stigma reduction. The activity will establish Service Delivery Networks and facility-level Quality Improvement teams to roll out patient-centered TB interventions at the health facility and community levels as well as integrate TB diagnosis and treatment as part of a hospital-wide approach to infection control and to accelerate case findings. The activity will also assist the Department of Health and LGUs to establish more responsive TB case-finding and case-holding activities in post-disaster environments.. .. ...

title.narrative: YouthworksPH

description.narrative: (Philippines): This is a youth-oriented, workforce development activity developed through a Global Development Alliance (GDA) with the local private sector. Youthworks PH addresses the persistently high levels of unemployment and underemployment of Philippine youth. Funds will mobilize local private sector resources at a ratio of 1:6 to provide innovative, work-based training opportunities for youth ages 15-29 who are not in education, employment, or training. The activity will also establish city-based, labor-market information systems, and sponsor broader policy reforms at the national and local levels. The GDA also has a strong advocacy component, to highlight the benefits of technical-vocational education. COVID impacts on the local economy and restrictions on mobility has necessitated a shift to a blended learning approach. Called the Flexible Work Training Program, the activity will now deliver life skills modules online through a four-month period, and mentors will provide these youth with personalized support throughout the program. The activity has also worked with the private sector to generate resources so that out-of-school youth participants are provided with connectivity, including free Microsoft 360 access, waived fees for online payments, and internet access through prepaid cards. The activity will also pivot to sectors with opportunities opened up by the pandemic (such as in ICT and pharmacy services), while focusing on partnerships that have remained committed to support out-of-school youth. Post-secondary and tertiary institutions offering middle-skills training are engaged in the delivery of work-based training programs. These institutions provide the in-school/theoretical component, prior to the deployment of trainees to private sector partners for the in-company training. They also partner to develop industry-relevant skills training and certification, and are the channels for scholarships provided by the Technical Education and Skills Develop

title.narrative: Marawi Response Project (MRP)
Proyecto de la respuesta de Marawi (MRP)

description.narrative: (Filipinas):. En mayo de 2017, el conflicto violento entró en erupción entre los grupos militantes ISIS-inspirados y los militares filipinos en Marawi en Mindanao musulmán. El cerco desplazó el toda la población de la ciudad, creando choques económicos y sociales en la región. En agosto de 2018, cerca de 69.000 ciudadanos desplazados no podían volver a casa, forzado para permanecer en las comunidades del anfitrión por un tiempo extendido, incluyendo en la provincia de Lanao del Sur donde está limitada la capacidad de gobiernos locales, y en la ciudad de Iligan, donde están una minoría las personas desplazadas, que son predominante musulmanes, religiosa. Dispersan y tienen menos capacidad de recibir la información y de proporcionar la reacción en esfuerzos de la recuperación, y no pueden a las familias vueltas a poner extensamente participar en la toma de decisión de gobiernos anfitriones. Las comunidades del anfitrión están experimentando la presión de la dislocación en la economía local y el suministro de servicios público. La situación creó las grietas que debilitan la cohesión social y aumentan las amenazas del extremismo violento, fomentando los mensajes negativos que se explotan y se utilizan como parte de la narrativa del reclutamiento. El proyecto de la respuesta de Marawi ayuda a comunidades afectadas para emplear soluciones durables a su dislocación mejorando situaciones económicas y fomentando la cohesión social. Los fondos del FY 2018 permitirán a organizaciones basadas en la Comunidad de la sociedad civil organizar y representar a ciudadanos del anfitrión y de comunidades desplazadas. La actividad conducirá la educación cívica y sesiones cívicas del compromiso, y convoca ayuntamientos con gobiernos locales para dibujar la atención a los desafíos urgentes hechos frente por las comunidades de la blanco. Concederá concesiones pequeñas, en especie a una piscina grande de los grupos comunitarios a ayudar a dirigir las necesidades transitorias de las poblaciones desplazado y del anfitrión, y construye tolerancia entre la gente. La ayuda de la sociedad civil de la actividad en el poste-conflicto Marawi construirá la resistencia contra la extensión de amenazas extremistas en áreas objetivo, una prioridad de la comunidad de la política exterior de los E.E.U.U. ....

(Philippines): .In 2017, violent conflict erupted between ISIS-inspired militant groups and the Philippine military in Marawi, Muslim Mindanao. The siege displaced the city's entire population, creating economic and social shocks even in the environs. As of April 2020, over 25 thousand families remain displaced in Lanao Del Sur and Lanao Del Norte, as a result of the Marawi conflict (based on UNHCR report). The large displacement stressed the limited capacity of local governments, created social divisions and disrupted the local economy that is largely agriculture-based. The underground economy in the area is evident, with reports of drugs, guns and human smuggling. Displaced communities are threatened by violent extremism, as resentment is exploited as part of the recruitment narrative. ..FY 2020 funds enable MRP to continue assisting affected communities in the Lanao region, particularly in economic recovery and integration of displaced citizens. MRP will offer workforce readiness and lifeskills training especially to youth. Through commodity support and capacity development, MRP will help displaced entrepreneurs to re-start their businesses and revive livelihood activities of displaced and host communities. Funds will also support civic engagement training and town halls with local governments to amplify the voices of displaced citizens. MRP will also support small-scale community infrastructure such as repair of water and irrigation systems and installation of solar dryers to address community needs and build social bonds in the process. .. .. .

title.narrative: Family Planning Innovations and Capacity Building Platforms (ReachHealth)

description.narrative: (Philippines): .ReachHealth will collaborate with the Department of Health (DOH) and Commission on Population and Development (POPCOM) to institutionalize high-impact practices that improve voluntary Family Planning (FP) and adolescent reproductive health care. The activity will build the capacity of health and non-health actors to expand access to integrated and quality health care and introduce new technologies and innovations to reduce unmet need for voluntary FP and reproductive health care and teen pregnancies. Non-traditional partners (academia, partners in the education and private sector) will be engaged to cultivate new approaches to solve persistent challenges.Funds will mitigate the impact of COVID-19 in the delivery of voluntary FP and reproductive health care by strengthening health-seeking behaviors among adolescents, youth, women and men through the use of digital technology; fortifying the quality of patient-centered approaches to voluntary FP and adolescent reproductive health care through scale-up of targeted high-impact interventions; enhance supervision and mentoring for public and private sector providers; support policies and systems that will bolster service delivery (availability of wide-range of contraceptives at service delivery points, skilled health workers, PhilHealth accredited health facilities, referral system); and strengthen community participation and private sector engagement. USAID will work with and build the capacity of local organizations to test and introduce state-of-the-art technologies, new approaches, and partnerships that are proven responsive to current situations. USAID will also bolster the capacity of the DOH, POPCOM and local health systems; and facilitate local solutions to promote self-reliance and sustainability and contribute to inclusive growth. Improved quality and management of health services also contributes to greater effectiveness and accountability to the U.S. taxpayer... .. ...

title.narrative: Collaborating, Learning, and Adapting for Improved Health (CLAimHealth)

description.narrative: (Philippines): The Collaborating, Learning, and Adapting for Improved Health (CLAimHealth) activity serves as the primary monitoring, evaluation, and learning mechanism for the USAID/Philippines Health Project. CLAimHealth supports the USAID/Philippines Office of Health (OH) ensure strategic collaboration among its various health activities to generate and use high-quality monitoring, evaluation, and research data to catalyze continuous learning and adaptive management in the face of new knowledge and changing contexts. To advance the Department of Health (DOH) and local government units in their journey to self-reliance, USAID supports the systematic generation and utilization of accurate and timely data to inform decision-making, scale-up effective health strategies and interventions, and track health outcomes. FY 2020 funds will continue to support OH to systematically monitor and document high-impact health interventions and practices, including approaches for their scale up; conduct implementation research (i.e., potentially a joint learning initiative with health implementing partners to systematically document and assess adaptive actions to ensure the continuity of essential health services in the time of COVID-19); and strengthen the capacity of OH and implementing partners on using data for decision-making, fostering learning and adaptive management, and creating a culture that supports and sustains improved collaboration, learning, and adapting. Adaptive management is fundamental for improving the performance of the health project and an important approach to ensuring effectiveness and accountability of U.S. taxpayer dollars, a U.S foreign policy priority. In addition, by tracking and monitoring project performance, USAID will be better able to measure its contributions to achieving the U.S. government Mission Objective to accelerate and sustain broad-based inclusive growth. ... .... .. .

participating-org.narrative: U.S. Government - U.S. Agency for International Development

title.narrative: Delivering Effective Government for Competitiveness and Inclusive Growth (DELIVER)

description.narrative: (Philippines): DELIVER is an integral component of the U.S. government's Indo-Pacific Strategy vision and advances the country's Journey to Self-Reliance. It seeks to assist the Philippine government to institutionalize innovative and lasting solutions to strengthen government functions and capacity to mobilize domestic resources and allocate and use these resources effectively and transparently; implement critical public infrastructure projects and support initiatives that will expand private sector's participation in infrastructure development and delivery; and strengthen small and medium enterprises (SME) to be able to compete in local and global markets.Funds will advance tax policy and tax administration reform measures, including assistance to the Department of Finance on policy reform dialogues, a technical analytics for various tax reform packages, and support for the Bureau of Internal Revenue's digital transformation in tax administration to streamline and simplify tax procedures and improve tax compliance and enforcement. Interventions in public financial management will help increase the absorptive capacity of Philippine spending agencies. DELIVER will initiate program budgeting to ensure convergence and optimal infrastructure budgeting as part of the current administration's Build Build Build program. It will support improvements in the right-of-way acquisition, which is the most significant constraint on expeditious infrastructure procurement. It will support SMEs by strengthening value chain linkages in priority industries identified in the Philippine government's industry roadmap to enable them to actively and sustainably participate in the local and global markets. The activity will back pilot projects for business matching between financial institutions and SMEs to improve access to finance, and between buyers and/or processors and producers to improve profitability and reduce intermediation costs. ... .. .

title.narrative: The Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao (BARMM) Health Capacity Building (BARMMHealth)

description.narrative: (Philippines): .The Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao (BARMM) Health activity (BARMMHealth) will work with the Ministry of Health (MOH)-BARMM, Department of Health (DOH) and Commission on Population and Development (POPCOM) Regional Offices, local government units (LGUs) and communities to respond to high unmet need for voluntary modern family planning (FP) and teenage pregnancy rates. Operating within a complex environment of underserved populations, geographically isolated and conflict-affected areas, BARMMHealth aims to build strong health systems by catalyzing the commitment and capacity of the government, civil society, private sector, and communities to develop, implement, and finance solutions to improve voluntary FP and reproductive health care delivery in the region. Funds will improve social norms and strengthen healthy behaviors among youth, women, and men; implement high-impact practices and expand access to voluntary FP and adolescent reproductive health cares through mobilizing LGUs, private sector, community, non-health government agencies and other stakeholders; and support policies and systems that will institutionalize and sustain voluntary FP services. To mitigate the effect of COVID-19, BARMMHealth will continue to work with MOH-BARMM to implement policies that ensure the continuity of health services and unhampered access to voluntary FP and adolescent reproductive health care. It will support the local health emergency teams, provincial health offices, and community organizations to continue community outreach activities such as voluntary FP on Wheels, which brings services to isolated and conflict areas. BARMMHealth with other implementing partners will build the capacity of the MOH-BARMM to bolster the local health system and to facilitate local solutions to promote self-reliance and sustainability through improved quality and management of health services. This is vital to advancing the country's journey to self-reliance... .

title.narrative: Regulatory Reform Support Program for National Development (RESPOND)

description.narrative: (Philippines): The RESPOND activity advances the administration's vision for a free and open Indo-Pacific in particular through its contribution to the Trade and Investment initiative under the economic pillar. RESPOND seeks to improve regulatory quality that will lead to greater market access, more competition, lower transactions costs and, ultimately, higher levels of trade and investment. RESPOND seeks to enhance market competition and strengthen regulatory capacity and governance. To advance market competition, RESPOND will support Philippine efforts to reduce barriers to entry, regulatory burdens, and transaction costs for business. To strengthen the capacity of regulatory institutions, it will seek to improve regulatory oversight and strengthen transparency and accountability mechanisms. RESPOND will support the implementation of the Ease of Doing Business and Efficient Government Service Delivery Act through technical assistance to improve the capacity of the Anti-Red Tape Authority (ARTA), a newly formed unit under the Office of the President. RESPOND will support ARTA develop its Philippine Business Regulations Information System and its Anti-Red Tape Enterprise Management Information System to advance regulatory transparency. It will also build ARTA's capacity to conduct regulatory impact analysis and set up a regulatory management system. RESPOND will help enhance the capacity of the Philippine Competition Commission (PCC) to act against anti-competitive practices. It will assist the PCC identify industries and sectors for competition enforcement and advance a competition policy framework for government entities. It will support the Government Commission on Government Owned Corporations to advance its public enterprise reform agenda. Finally, RESPOND will support the Department of Information and Communication to implement Digital Philippines, particularly on the establishment of a central business portal.. .. .

participating-org.narrative: U.P. PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION RESEARCH AND EXTENSION SERVICE FO

title.narrative: Advancing Basic Education in the Philippines ABC+

description.narrative: (Philippines): ABC+ will continue to improve basic life skills, including the ability to read and do math, for children in the early grades in schools throughout the Philippines. In light of COVID-19, more focus will be given to distance learning and mitigating learning loss, thereby supporting the Philippine government's goal of ensuring quality, accessible, and inclusive education, even in times of crisis.ABC+ will support the government's learning continuity plan, especially in early childhood education, by providing textbooks and materials; improving the quality of teacher education and training instruction; supporting better assessment, monitoring and evaluation practices; and improving education management systems. The activity will advise the Philippines Department of Education (DepEd) in packaging early literacy instructional content across a variety of media platforms, and ensure equitable access to these resources. ABC+ will also support regional coaching teams to determine appropriate learning delivery modalities. The activity will prepare teachers for the effects of school closures by developing rapid, easy-to-use assessment tools to gauge their students' levels of language and literacy skills as they return from interruption to their education. ABC+ will help develop instructional resources to remediate foundational language and literacy skills. The activity will train teachers on the use of distance learning materials and provide guidance on working with home partners in teaching. ABC+ will work with DepEd counterparts to develop messages to prioritize children's social and emotional well-being during the current crisis, as well as play-based activities at home that can reinforce literacy and numeracy skills. The activity will leverage public-private partnership resources to engage and empower civil society, academia, and community members, in support of the learning continuity plan, all of which advance Philippine self-reliance.

title.narrative: Safe Water

description.narrative: (Philippines): .The Safe Water (SW) activity supports the Philippines' goal of improving water security, which is vital to increasing self-reliance, reducing poverty, supporting economic growth, strengthening public health, and promoting resilience to disasters and infectious diseases such as COVID-19. Working in water stressed communities in Palawan, Negros Occidental, and Saranggani, SW will increase access to resilient water supply and sanitation services as well as improve the sustainable management of water resources. Building on climate data, hydrological analyses and mapping of unserved areas, SW will provide technical assistance to enable local governments and water service providers (WSPs) to improve services and integrate these improvements into existing development plans. The activity will also help facilitate access to capital under the Unified Financing Framework (UFF) to address issues related to huge non-repayable debts, efficiency improvement, and service expansion. This will be complemented by capacity building for WSPs to ensure financial sustainability and operational viability. SW will also work with microfinance institutions to fund new sanitation facilities and water supply connection fees for households. To better manage water resources and reduce greenhouse gas emissions, the activity will forge stakeholder consensus on watershed protection; bolster local reforestation and forest protection initiatives, establish or replicate Payment for Ecosystem Services schemes; as well as support alternative and more sustainable livelihood for upland communities in partnership with NGOs, private foundations, and companies. Water supply side measures will also be complemented by water demand management. At the national level, SW will support the Government of the Philippines to implement the Philippine Water Supply and Sanitation Master Plan and the UFF, which are crucial in advancing key reforms in the water sector. .... .... .
